result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Paul Gill Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.

Def granted work release priv.
Def granted good time credit.
Def granted credit for time served.
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail w/in 7 days.

4 cases; Defendant Anthony Paul Gill in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony Paul Gill in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty asking to modigy bond to no abusive contact. it would change his living and that way he can be in drug court. State is asking for notice. Atty comments-- alleged Vic in 106 case. State does not agree with the motion to modify.

State would like matter held soon if the agreement is going to stand.  Status conference scheduled for November 27, 2018 at 01:15 pm.
